caption:
This photograph displays an expansive agricultural landscape featuring meticulously arranged crop fields. In the foreground, there are multiple rectangular plots aligned in a grid-like pattern marked out by red dirt pathways. The crops, appearing lush and possibly in early stages of growth, cover the fields extensively, hinting at a professional, large-scale farming operation.

The color palette predominantly features shades of green from the crops, contrasting with the reddish-brown hue of the dirt paths. This orderly pattern speaks to a well-planned agricultural management system.

Beyond the fields, the landscape gradually transforms into a more undulating terrain covered with patches of greenery and scattered buildings, possibly farmhouses or storage structures. The background of the image gently fades into a hilly area under a clear sky with hints of further vegetation and small structures that dot the horizon, suggesting a rural setting.

Overall, the composition provides a perspective that captures both the large-scale agriculture in the foreground and the natural, more rugged terrain in the distance, offering a comprehensive view of this farming region.
title: Pineapple fields.  About one third of Molokai's residents are connected with pineapple production, but planting will cease in 1975 water is a critical problem.  Other crops, such as sorghum, papaya and vegetables are suggested as an alternative to pineapple
